alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 8:30PM CDT until June 03 at 7:32AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Caddo, Blaine, Custer and Canadian Counties.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC011-015-017-039-031245- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.W.0006.000000T0000Z-220603T1232Z/ /BRIO2.1.ER.220602T0642Z.220602T1930Z.220603T0632Z.NO/ 830 PM CDT Thu Jun 2 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Middle and upper bottomlands may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County experience flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 11.0 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
